entries.meaning: A pointed projection on a horseshoe to prevent its slipping.
A spike on the sole of a boot to prevent slipping, particularly used in logging

verbs.description: calk (third-person singular simple present calks, present participle calking, simple past and past participle calked)

examples: When a joint was calked, the bell piece was then separated,

entries.meaning: To make an indentation in the edge of a metal plate, as along a seam in a steam boiler or an iron ship, to force the edge of the upper plate hard against the lower and so fill the crevice.

description: From French calque, ultimately derived from Latin calcō (“I trample”). Doublet of calque.

verbs.description: calk (third-person singular simple present calks, present participle calking, simple past and past participle calked)

entries.meaning: To copy (a drawing) by rubbing the back of it with red or black chalk, and then passing a blunt stylus or needle over the lines, so as to leave a tracing on the paper or other thing against which it is laid or held.
